result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J. SANDERS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping as repeater-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling as repeater [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: on each count concurrent and concurrent with 15 CF 525.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time work and/or job search combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Continue with his mental health treatment.

Take all medications as prescribed and in prescribed doses.

Have no contact with Rahr West Museum, St. John's United Church of Christ, St. Vincent DePaul, Stephanie Bowman and Diane Murray.  
Submit DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: concurrent with Count 1 and with 15 CF 525.

Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 10-21-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
RE:  bail jumping as repeater, on 09-27-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of bail jumping, burglary and 2 counts theft.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-05-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
